item.title: Docs: .network_settings
item.description:
Description

The .network_settings property allows access to the GeometryNetworkWriterSettings and is present on the GeometryIntermodalWriterSettings. These settings are identical to the settings on the GeometryNetworkWriter since under the hood the GeometryIntermodalWriter utilises the GeometryNetworkWriter for the persistence of the physical road, rail, and ferry network and is therefore configured via the same settings, accessible via this property.

Return type

GeometryNetworkWriterSettings

Example 1

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# access GIS network settings
geo_writer.settings.network_settings.<some_method>

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class GeometryIntermodalWriterSettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .routed_services_settings
item.description:
Description

The .routed_services_settings property allows access to the GeometryRoutedServicesWriterSettings and is present on the GeometryIntermodalWriterSettings. These settings allow you to configure the aspects of the GIS writer regarding the routed services, e.g., the public transport services routed on the service network.

Return type

GeometryRoutedServicesWriterSettings

Example 1

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# access GIS routed services settings
geo_writer.settings.routed_services_settings.<some_method>

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class GeometryIntermodalWriterSettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .service_network_settings
item.description:
Description

The .service_network_settings property allows access to the GeometryServiceNetworkWriterSettings and is present on the GeometryIntermodalWriterSettings. These settings allow you to configure the aspects of the GIS writer regarding the service network, e.g., the public transport network routed on top of the physical network (disregarding specific lines).

Return type

GeometryServiceNetworkWriterSettings

Example 1

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# access GIS service network settings
geo_writer.settings.service_network_settings.<some_method>

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class GeometryIntermodalWriterSettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .set_country(+)
item.description:
Description

Set the destination country of the to be generated GIS files by the GeometryIntermodalWriter. This country name is used to determine the best possible coordinate reference system (projection) to use for the geometry information of the outputs.

If the country is not set by the user, the choice for the destination coordinate reference system is based on the coordinate reference system of the source network that is to be persisted. This is likely sufficient in most cases, but sometimes a country specific projection is required in which case the country can be provided here.

Whenever a country name is to be supplied, make sure this name complies with the ISO 3166 standard ( see for example https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes ).

Signature

.set_country(country_name: str)

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
country_name String None Context dependent The destination country name (ISO 3166)

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class GeometryIntermodalWriterSettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .set_output_directory(+)
item.description:
Description

Set the output directory to use for the GIS output files. This is expected to be explicitly set by the user, otherwise the writer will fail.

Signature

.set_output_directory(output_dir: str)

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
output_dir String None N/A The output directory to use

Return type

N/A

Example 1 - minimum configuration

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class GeometryIntermodalWriterSettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .zoning_settings
item.description:
Description

The .zoning_settings property allows access to the GeometryZoningWriterSettings and is present on the GeometryIntermodalWriterSettings. These settings allow you to configure the intermodal aspects of the GIS writer, e.g., regarding the origin and destination zones as well as the transfer zones (public transport stops).

Return type

GeometryZoningWriterSettings

Example 1

from planit import *

planit = Planit()

# intermodal converter
intermodal_converter = planit.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.INTERMODAL)

# PLANit reader
planit_reader = intermodal_converter.create_reader(IntermodalReaderType.PLANIT, AUSTRALIA)
planit_reader.settings.set_input_directory(PLANIT_INPUT_PATH)

# GeoIo (GIS geometry shape) writer
geo_writer = intermodal_converter.create_writer(IntermodalWriterType.SHAPE)
geo_writer.settings.set_output_directory(OUTPUT_PATH)
geo_writer.settings.set_country("Australia")

# access GIS zoning settings
geo_writer.settings.zoning_settings.<some_method>

# perform conversion (with pt services)
intermodal_converter.convert_with_services(planit_reader, geo_writer)

See also

N/A

Source code
